direction.raw_text: And, again, at "Seize The Day," my tuberculosis Friday night.

direction.raw_text: Marla -- the big tourist.  Her lie reflected my lie. Marla rests her chin on the man's shoulder.  Tears roll down her cheeks.  She wipes at them. EXT. FIRST METHODIST CHURCH - NIGHT Marla walks out,  The support group's dispersing.  Jack exits amongst them.  He spots Marla walking away.

direction.raw_text: And suddenly, I felt nothing.  I couldn't cry.  So, once again, I could not sleep. Jack stares after Marla for a long moment.  He walks away. INT. BEDROOM - LATER Jack, in underwear, is cross-legged on the floor, assembling IKEA furniture, CORDLESS PHONE shouldered to his ear.

direction.raw_text: No, I just can't believe that card is declined -- Okay, okay, let me give you a different card number. Jack gets his wallet off the floor, pulls out another card and, MOS over the following, he reads it into the phone.

direction.raw_text: Next group, after guided meditation, after we open our chakras, when it's time to hug, I'm going to grab that little bitch, Marla Singer, pin her arms against her sides and say... INT. MEETING ROOM - NIGHT - JACK'S IMAGINATION CLOSE ON JACK as he CLAMPS his arms around Marla.

direction.raw_text: Marla, you liar, you big tourist.  I need this.  Get out. INT. LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Jack, in pajamas, stares at Home Shopping Network on his TV.

direction.raw_text: When you have insomnia, you're never really asleep and you're never really awake.  I hadn't slept in four days... INT. SMALL PROTESTANT CHURCH - NIGHT Jack walks in and joins the crowd, looking around.  People are chattering with each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, in here, in everyone, there's the squint of a five-day headache. Yet they forced themselves to be positive.  They never said "parasite;" they said "agent."  They always talked about getting better.

direction.raw_text: Okay, everyone. Everyone sits in chairs.  Jack catches sight of Marla.

direction.raw_text: To open tonight's communion, Chloe would like to say a few words. Taking the lectern is CHLOE, a pale, sickly girl whose skin stretches yellowish and tight over her bones.  She wears a head bondage.  She clears her throat.

direction.raw_text: Ahh, Chloe.  Chloe looked the way Joni Mitchell's skeleton would look if you made it smile and walk around a party being extra nice to everyone.

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm still here -- but I don't know for how long.  That's as much certainty as anyone can give me.  but I've got some good news -- I no longer have any fear of death. APPLAUSE from around the room.

direction.raw_text: But... I am in a pretty lonely place. No one will have sex with me.  I'm so close to the end and all I want is to get laid for the last time.  I have pornographic movies in my apartment, and lubricants and amyl nitrate ... The LEADER gingerly takes control of the microphone.

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Chloe.  Everyone, let's thank Chloe.

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Chloe. INT. SMALL PROTESTANT CHURCH - LATER LEADER Now, you're standing at the entrance to your cave.  You step inside your cave and you walk.  Keep walking. Jack's face, eyes closed, is motionless.

direction.raw_text: If I did have a tumor, I'd name it Marla.  Marla...the little scratch on the roof of your mouth that would heal if only you could stop tonguing it, but you can't.

SMALL PROTESTANT CHURCH - LATER Everyone stands and mills about, pairing-off.

An ATTENDANT'S HANDS set coffee down with a small container of cream.

MAIN ROOM Jack sits on the bed.  He turns on the TV.  It's tuned to the "Sheraton Channel," shows WAITERS serving people in a large BANQUET ROOM.  Jack stops brushing his teeth, feels something on the bed, lifts it -- a small DINNER MINT. INT. AIRPLANE CABIN - IN FLIGHT - NIGHT Jack sits next to a frumpy WOMAN.  They chat.  Jack turns to look at his food, takes a bite.  He turns back and it's... --a BALD MAN next to him, talking.  Jack takes another bite, turns back and it's... --a BUSINESSMAN next to him.  Jack takes another bite, turns back, and it's... --a BUSINESS WOMAN next to him.

direction.raw_text: The people I meet on each flight -- they're single-serving friends. Between take-off and landing, we have our time together, but that's all we get. INT. AIRPLANE CABIN - LANDING Jack's eyes snap open.

direction.raw_text: On a long enough time line, the survival rate for everyone drops to zero. Two TECHNICIANS lead Jack to the BURNT-OUT SHELL of a WRECKED AUTOMOBILE.  Jack sets down his briefcase, opens it and starts to make notes on a CLIPBOARDED FORM.

direction.raw_text: I'm a recall coordinator.  My job is to apply the formula.  It's a story problem.

direction.raw_text: The father must've been huge.  See how the fat burnt into the driver's seat with his polyester shirt?  Very "modern art."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take the number of vehicles in the field, (A), and multiply it by the probable rate of failure, (B), then multiply the result by the average out-of-court settlement, (C).  A times B times C equals X...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. AIRPLANE CABIN - MOVING DOWN RUNWAY Jack is speaking to the BUSINESSWOMAN next to him.

direction.raw_text: If you were to add nitric acid to the soap-making process, one would get nitroglycerin.  With enough soap, one could blow up the world, if one were so inclined. Tyler SNAPS the briefcase shut.  Jack stares.

No people except for Jack and a SECURITY TASK FORCE MAN.  The Security TFM, smirking, holds a receiver to his ear from an official phone on the wall.

We use the indefinite aricle: "A dildo."  Never "Your dildo." Jack sees, through the window, Tyler, at the curb, throwing his briefcase into the back of a shiny, red CONVERTIBLE. A foot of concrete is important when your next- door neighbor lets her hearing aid go and has to watch game shows at full volume... The taxi turns a corner and Jack sees the front of the building.  A diffuse CLOUD of SMOKE wafts away from a BLOWN- OUT SECTION of the fifteenth floor.  FIRETRUCKS, POLICE CARS and a MOB are all crowded around the lobby area.

He pushes through the fray of people, into the... INT. LOBBY The DOORMAN sees Jack enter, gives a sad smile, shakes his head.  Jack starts for the elevator.

His feet CRUNCH glass.

KABOOM!  SCREEN GOES WHITE. EXT. PAYPHONE - RESUMING Jack looks at the Doorman.  Tyler's BUSINESS CARD falls from the Filofax.  Jack catches it.

direction.raw_text: I'm keeping your license.  I know where you live.  I'm going to check on you.  If you aren't back in school and on your way to being a veterinarian in six weeks, you will be dead.  Get the hell out of here. Raymond staggers to his feet, heads down an alleyway.  Jack and Tyler watch Raymond flee, then Tyler looks at Jack.

BUSINESS OFFICE - NIGHT SLOW MOTION: in the deserted office, gasoline filled COMPUTER MONITORS begin to EXPLODE...BOOM...BOOM...BOOM... ! EXT. CITY STREETS -- MORNING Luxury AUTOMOBILES are parked, splattered with BIRD SHIT. EXT. PAPER ST. HOUSE - BACKYARD - DAWN VIEWED OUT 3RD STORY WINDOW: Tyler uses a RAKE, dragging it across rocks and dirt.  He stops a moment, rake on his shoulder, staring off.  Then, back to work...

direction.raw_text: ... You are not how much money you have in the bank.  You are not the shoes you wear. Tyler's marking a large SQUARE in the weeds and rubble of the backyard, kicking rocks away, dragging the rake...

direction.raw_text: He had a plan.  Maybe you just didn't see it till it hit you between the eyes. (pause) But, it started to make sense... in a Tyler sort of way.  No fear.  No distractions.  The ability to let that which does not matter truly slide. EXT. PAPER STREET - NIGHT Jack gets off the bus.  As the bus pulls away, we see it dropped Jack off right in front of the house. INT. KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER Jack enters.  Tyler, dressed in FATIGUES and splattered with PAINT, grabs BEERS from the refrigerator.

direction.raw_text: Go on in.  We're celebrating. INT. LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Jack, bewildered, enters carrying beers.  Tyler does NOT follow.  BOB, RICKY and several other fight club guys sit in front at the TV, chanting not too loudly, all also dressed in FATIGUES and splattered with PAINT.

direction.raw_text: We believe this is related to the recent acts of vandalism around the city.  It's some kind of organized group, and we are coordinating a rigorous investigation. Jack turns, sees Tyler in the archway, watching him.  Tyler tips his beer to toast, pulls back, out of sight.

Jack, in a WAITER'S UNIFORM, looks apprehensively to OTHER WAITERS: BOB... RICKY... ANGEL FACE -- who all give each other a look. INT. HALLWAY Jacobs saunters down an empty hall.  He stops to check his tie in a mirror.  He pushes open the door of the MEN'S BATHROOM -- face to face with TYLER. INT. BATHROOM Tyler GRABS Commissioner Jacobs, pulling him into the bathroom.  He slaps a piece of tape over Jacobs' mouth.  The OTHER "WAITERS" rush in.  Jack stays back to keep the door shut.  Tyler and the others hold Jacobs, pulling down his pants.  Bob snaps a rubber band -- reaches to Jacob s crotch.

direction.raw_text: Wrap it around the top of his hackie- sack.

direction.raw_text: You're not going to continue your "rigorous investigation."  You will publicly state that there is no underground group.  Or -- imagine, the rest of your life with your scrotum flapping empty.

Tyler gives Angel Face a hearty slap on the back. Angel Face smiles at Tyler, nods, grinning. Jack sees this, his eyes narrowing, stops walking. INT. TAVERN BASEMENT - NIGHT Fight club in full swing.  Jack battles Angel Face, BEATING the shit out of him with unprecedented viciousness.

direction.raw_text: I felt like putting a bullet between the eyes of every Panda that wouldn't screw to save its species. The crowd shouts maniacally, save Tyler, who watches with an inscrutable stone face. Angel Face tries to speak, but Jack POUNDS too hard.  Blood flies.  The crowd begins to grow QUIETER.

direction.raw_text: I wanted to open the dump valves on oil tankers and smother all the French beaches I'd never see. Finally, Angel Face lies still, unconscious.  Jack stops, stares down, numb.  Jack walks away -- the crowd parts to let him pass.  Jack scans faces... finds Tyler.

direction.name: direction

STREET Tyler pulls the stolen car away from the curb.  It has two bumperstickers: "RECYCLE YOUR ANIMALS" and "MAKE MINE VEAL." INT. STOLEN CAR - MOVING - LATER RAIN GUSHES down.  Jack stews, silent.  The car moves down a HIGHWAY, intermittently illuminated by oncoming headlights.

direction.raw_text: Something on your mind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Tyler shrugs; turns on the RADIO, ignores Jack.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fight club was the beginning.  Now it's out of the basements and there's a name for it -- Project Mayhem.

direction.raw_text: This does not belong to us.  We are not the leaders.  We are not special.

You have to forget everything you know, everything you think you know -- about life, about friendship, about you and me. Tyler looks at Jack, his hands in the air.  Jack looks at Tyler with dead eyes.

Their faces are illuminated by the light of the flares.  Tyler smiles. They SMASH into the stalled car -- AIRBAGS INFLATE!  The back of their car whips around and carries it into a ass- over-tea-kettle ROLL down a hill...

Tyler sits beside the stunned, wounded Jack.

You will see tiny figures pounding corn and laying-strips of venison on the empty car pool lane of the ruins of a superhighway. Tyler stands, gives Jack's head a pat.

direction.raw_text: Feel better, champ. INT. KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER Jack sits at the table, sips coffee.  He's pale, dazed, seems broken.  He hears the faint SOUND of SAWING and HAMMERING, unsure of where it's coming from. Marla walks into the kitchen and goes straight to the counter.  Her back is to Jack as he looks at her.  She pours ccffee and lights a cigarette.  A beat of silence, then:

After a moment, he opens the basement door, heads downstairs... INT. BASEMENT STAIRCASE Tyler walks upstairs, passing as Jack continues down... INT. BASEMENT - CONTINUOUS Jack looks around.  TRIPLE-DECKER BUNKS clutter the basement, as many as can fit into the space.

direction.raw_text: Tyler... ?  What's this for? From upstairs, the SOUND of the DOORBELL. INT. LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Jack opens the door. Tyler closes the door. EXT. PORCH - NIGHT Ricky remains at attention.  Jack bursts out with a BROOM, knocks the brown bag out of Ricky's hand, kicks it away.

Tyler steps out. Jack stays in the doorway, locking eyes on Bob.  To all the following questions, Ricky answers "Sir!" -- TYLER You have two black shirts?  Two pair black trousers?  One pair black boots?  Two pair black socks?  One black coat?  Three hundred dollars personal burial money?  Go inside. Ricky goes in.  Tyler turns to Bob.

PORCH - DAY Jack looks out the window.  Bob stands motionless.  There's another "applicant," a SHORT GUY, beside Bob.  Ricky comes out the front door with the BROOM...

direction.raw_text: So it went... EXT. BACKYARD - DAY Tyler works with a HALF DOZEN SPACE MONKEYS, preparing the square of backyard.  They pull weeds, clear rocks; working with shovels, rakes, etc.  They cart away WHEELBARROWS of rocks and carry in SACKS of FERTILIZER.

direction.raw_text: To what purpose, might one ask? Well, one might ask, if not for the first rule of Project Mayhem. Jack turns to look around the kitchen.  THREE SPACE MONKEYS work -- one SCRUBBING the FLOOR, one WASHING DISHES, one SCRUBBING the walls.  Jack walks out.

direction.raw_text: In Tyler We Trust. INT. JACK'S ROOM - DAY Jack opens his eyes, awakening to sunlight thru the window.

direction.raw_text: He was gone. INT. LIVING ROOM - DAY Jack comes downstairs... finds DOZENS of SPACE MONKEYS. INT.  KITCHEN - NIGHT Jack enters.  Space Monkeys render fat and make soap.  They pinch HERBS, adding them to the mix.  They add VODKA.  Off to the side, a couple Monkeys stir a vat of RICE.  On the wall is a big bulletin board with HUNDREDS of DRIVER's LICENSES; a sign above it: "HUMAN SACRIFICES."

direction.raw_text: "You are not a beautiful and unique snowflake.  You are the same decaying organic matter as everything else. We are all part of the same compost heap."

direction.raw_text: Planet Tyler. Jack dips a spoon into the rice, chomps on it irritatingly.

direction.raw_text: "We are the all-singing, all-dancing crap of the world." Jack picks up a BOTTLE of VODKA.

direction.raw_text: I had to hug the walls, trapped inside this clockwork of Space Monkeys, cooking and working and sleeping in teams. INT. READING ROOM - NIGHT Jack enters, vodka in hand.  TEN SPACE MONKEYS here, reading.

direction.raw_text: The house became a living thing, wet inside from so many people sweating and breathing.  So many people moving, the house moved. Jack walks out. INT. OFFICE - DAY Jack enters.  Angel Face reads a book, marks on a chart. Space Monkeys shuffle PAPERS and NEWS CLIPPINGS.  Walls are lined with FILES, each labeled with a STREET ADDRESS, under SIGNS: "Mischief," "Disinformation," "Arson." Jack's eye lingers on "Arson." He starts flipping through a file.  Angel Face comes to take the file from him.

direction.raw_text: That wouldn't interest you.

direction.raw_text: The first rule of Project -- JACK Right, right. As Angel Face replaces the file, Jack notices -- a LYE- BURNED KISS-SCAR on the back of Angel Face's hand. EXT. BACK YARD - NIGHT Jack takes a swig of vodka, smokes.  In the BACKGROUND, a Space Monkey WHACKS an APPLICANT with a BROOM.  It's a ritual; no words.  Other Space Monkeys tend the garden.

direction.raw_text: I'm all alone.  I Am Jack's Broken Heart. Jack drops his cigarette in the gravel, steps on it.  A Space Monkey immediately comes to clean it up.

direction.raw_text: Get away from me!

There's a LOUD COMMOTION from the house, VOICES SHOUTING. Jack heads to the back door... INT. KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS Jack enters.  Ricky crawls, bleeding from a gunshot wound to the LEG.  Space Monkeys begin a rudimentary job of treating the wound.  Other Space Monkeys carry in a DEAD BODY in BLACK CLOTHES and SKI MASK, putting it on the table.

direction.raw_text: What's going on? Space Monkeys stare at the body.  The Mechanic, sweating, gets to his knees and pulls the ski mask off the corpse -- it's BOB, with a gunshot wound to the HEAD.

direction.raw_text: You are the worst thing that ever happened to me. DOORS HISS SHUT.  The BUS LEAVES, heading away.  Jack seems relieved.  Then, a SCREAM is HEARD from MARLA... Jack turns, looks... THROUGH THE BUS WINDOWS: the bus is filled with BALD MEN IN BLACK: Space Monkeys. Jack SPRINTS after the bus... The bus speeds away.  Onboard, Space Monkeys subdue Marla. Jack falls to the asphalt, rolls, files-flying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch! INT. POLICE STATION - DAY Jack RUNS to the front desk, crazed, dumps the armload of files on the desk in front of the DESK SERGEANT...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to arrest me.  I'm the leader of a terrorist organization responsible for acts of vandalism all over the city.  Detective Stern in arson knows who I am... INT. INTERROGATION ROOM - LATER Detective Stern and THREE DETECTIVES stand, staring at Jack, who's seated.  On the table are the phone bill and files.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are probably several hundred members in the metropolitan area. Chapters are sprouting in at least five other major cities.  They're tightly-regimented, with many cells capable of operating without a central leader.  Check this address:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: TWO WINDOWS SHATTER OUTWARD -- TWO MEN
HOSES, GAS MASKS, BEAKERS, TEST TUBES

direction.raw_text: Paper Street.  You'll find the body of Robert Paulson buried in the garden.  You'll also find numerous tubs used to make gallons of nitroglycerin.  The plan, I believe, is to blow up these credit card headquarters and the TRW building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why these buildings?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are not your job.  You are not how much money you have in the bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep him talking. Stern leaves.  A beat, then, the remaining Detectives smile at Jack with REVERENCE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really admire what you're doing. You're a brave man to order this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a genius, sir. They grab Jack and force him on his back on the table. Flat-Top has a rubber band; the Bald Detective has a knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know the drill.  You said if anyone ever tries to interfere with Project Mayhem, even you, we got to get his balls. Flat-Top PULLS Jack's pants completely off, tosses them aside.  Jack SCREAMS.  Flat-Top holds his legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's useless to fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is really a powerful gesture, Mr. Durden.  It'll set quite an example.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... you're making a mistake!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told us you'd say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not Tyler Durden!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told us you'd say that, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I am Tyler Durden and I'm ordering you to abort the mission!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said you would definitely say that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's our best time for a "cut and run?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is somebody timing this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait till the second hand gets to the twelve. A KNOCK at the door.  Flat-Top slaps a hand over Jack's mouth.  He and Redhead block view of the table as Baldy opens the door a crack.  Stern mutters:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of this info checks out.  Let's go to the place on Paper Street. Baldy glances back at the other Detectives, leaves, closing the door.  The two remaining Detectives continue.  Jack kicks and screams and writhes.  The Detectives wrangle him, but with more difficulty, now that Baldy's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Durden, you're going to fuck up the time! Jack gets one leg free, KICKS, knocks Flat-top backwards -- Flat-Top SLAMS the wall, falls.  Redhead lets go of one of Jack's arms, jams his elbow into Jack's throat... cutting off the airway.  Jack's face reddens... he's choking... Jack's free hand reaches, searching.. pulls Redhead's GUN and points it at him.  Redhead backs off. Jack gets up, gasping for air, PISTOL-WHIPS Flat-top as he rises. Jack grabs one of the files off the table. EXT. POLICE STATION - DAY Jack, without pants, in BOXER SHORTS, escapes out the BACK DOOR.  He looks at the ADDRESS on the file folder. EXT. STREET Jack SPRINTS down the middle of the street, gun in hand, looking like a complete madman.  Cars almost hit him. EXT. BANK BUILDING - LATER Jack, sweating and panting, stops, looks... then heads toward the BUILDING with the address "1888." EXT. 1888 LOBBY Jack tries the door.  Locked.  He lifts a cast iron bench, runs forward -- RAMS it into the glass.  The bench immediately recoils from the glass, SLAMS Jack's groin! Jack falls to his knees, doubled over, holding his package. Then, he rises, SHOOTS the glass... INT. 1888 LOBBY Jack pushes through the broken glass.  He sprints for the "PARKING" door... INT. GROUND LEVEL - PARKING Jack enters, looks -- NO CARS.  He bolts to the STAIRS... INT. TOP-LEVEL PARKING AREA - SEVENTH FLOOR Jack enters, heaving.  Again, NO CARS.  He moves from one SUPPORT POST to another, searching.  He finally spies, across the garage, NINE LARGE CANISTERS, heavily-WIRED. Jack runs to the BOMB, frantic.  He walks around it. There's a DIGITAL CLOCK, ticking down from "10:05"... Jack moves to pull the lid off one CANISTER, looks inside..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could be worse... Jack looks -- Tyler's seated, his back against one post.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could be standing under 37 stories of steel and concrete with a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gallons of nitroglycerin strapped to the support... oh, maybe it couldn't be...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You... you can't be serious about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a ridiculous thing to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't let you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you going to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop finishing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: our sentences.  Get your mind around that. Tyler gets up walks to Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing running through the streets in your underpants?  We both use that body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since when is Project Mayhem about murder?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The buildings were evacuated thirty minutes ago.  Everything's proceeding exactly as planned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know that.  There could still be people inside. Tyler keeps walking around, crosses his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe.  Maybe a couple of guys with shaved heads couldn't synchronize their watches.  Good riddance. Jack looks back to the BOMB, goes to it, wipes sweat off his face.  He starts finger the MANY WIRES, sorting them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't be doing that.  Unless you know which wires, in what order...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you know, I know. Jack holds his gun under one armpit, uses both hands to go through the tangle of colored wires.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or... maybe I knew you'd know, so I spent the whole day thinking about the wrong ones. Jack chooses one wire, GREEN, holds it in his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I'm wrong, we're both dead..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not about martyrdom. Jack twists the GREEN WIRE around his finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm pulling the green wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Green?  Did you say green? Tyler comes a little closer, leaning to try to get a look, seems genuinely concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't pull the green wire.  Pull anything but the green wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm serious.  That's the wrong one. Jack's unsure, swallowing, pulling the wire taunt, fingers trembling.  The SOUND of a VEHICLE is HEARD from below...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hear that?  Marla's here.  Just in the nick of time, eh? Jack looks to Tyler.  Tyler points towards the SOUND...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See for yourself. Jack releases the wire, walks to a RAILING, gun in hand, keeps an eye on Tyler.  Jack looks over the railing... BELOW, a BUS idles.  The doors open and MARLA'S dragged out, kicking and screaming, carried by SIX SPACE MONKEYS...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You motherfuckers... They carry Marla into the BUILDING'S ENTRANCE. Jack leans against the railing, exhausted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got everything.  The bombs.  The army.  I've got Marla.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob is dead, Tyler.  The police blew a hole in his head.  Was that part of your plan? Tyler thinks, shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob was a grown man.  In any great struggle, there will be casualties. Wouldn't that be implicit in the name?  Project "Mayhem."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck your struggle.  I want out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I quit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not an option, for the most obvious of reasons.  You need to get with the program. (looks at his watch) Seven minutes.  Let's get out of here. Tyler's walks away.  Jack looks at the gun in his hand.  He points the gun at Tyler...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tyler...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Defuse the bomb. Tyler stops walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask me nicely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Defuse the bomb, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Defuse the bomb?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Tyler strides towards the BOMB.  Jack trains the gun...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. Tyler looks at the BOMB, reaches over to it.  He grips the GREEN WIRE, yanks it out -- the CLOCK STOPS. Jack lowers his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did that for you.  As a gesture. Now, how fast can you run?  There are ten other bombs, in ten other buildings in the immediate area.  If you're going to get them all, you better get cracking. (looks at watch) Six minutes.  Green wires, remember. I'll be upstairs. Jack's stunned.  Tyler walks across the parking garage, past Jack, heading for the STAIRS. Jack aims the gun at Tyler's back, FIRES! Tyler ducks to one side, impossibly quick, avoiding... Tyler spins to face Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa!  What was that all about? Jack aims... FIRES! Tyler DODGES behind a post as the BULLET THROWS CONCRETE. Jack edges forward, gun held in both hands, moves around the post... Tyler is NOT THERE.  Jack turns, takes slow steps, moving the gun from side to side... Suddenly, a FIST ENTERS FRAME -- SLUGS Jack's face. Jack falls.  The gun goes CLATTERING across the floor... Jack turns, looking... Tyler's GONE.  Jack looks to the gun, scrambles to his feet, running to pick up the gun... Tyler KICKS Jack in the chest, sends Jack sprawling. Jack rolls, holding his chest.  He looks up, sees Tyler run into the STAIRWELL.  Jack grabs the gun and follows... INT. STAIRWELL Jack smashes the door open.  The stairwell's empty.  Jack RUNS up a flight of stairs, kicks open ANOTHER DOOR... INT. MAIN LOBBY Jack steps forward, gun up... TWO INTERLOCKED HANDS SLAM down onto his head.  Jack drops to the floor. Tyler backs away, laughing.  Jack gets to his feet, aims his gun...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fire at will. Jack clenches his teeth, FIRING -- nothing happens to Tyler. Jack FIRES TWICE -- no effect.  Tyler raises his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you expect? Jack charges.  Tyler dodges, PUNCHES, knocks the gun out of Jack's hand.  They FIGHT, trading PUNCHES, grappling, taking each other to the floor...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. SECURITY OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Banks of SECURITY MONITORS sit unmanned. ON ONE MONITOR: Jack is seen in the lobby, on the floor, alone, wrestling himself.  He swings his left hand up, punching empty air, then swings his right hand -- PUNCHING himself in the side of the head... INT. MAIN LOBBY Tyler and Jack fight viciously, bloodied.  Tyler manages to get his hands around Jack's throat, starts BANGING Jack's head against the floor... SECURITY MONITOR P.O.V. ... Jack's got his hands around his own throat, BANGING his own head against the floor, over and over... INT. MAIN LOBBY Jack manages to break Tyler's grip, KICKS Tyler away. Tyler springs to his feet, RUNS, heading for a STAIRCASE. Jack gets up, breathing hard, holding his head, follows... ON THE STAIRS, Tyler reaches the LOFT LEVEL, above the lobby, disappears around a corner.  Jack's right behind, turning the corner -- Tyler's NOT THERE. Jack receives a SHARP SLAP on the back of the head.  He wheels.  Tyler isn't there.  A TAP on his shoulder.  Jack turns around -- WHAM! -- Tyler PUNCHES his face.  Jack falls against the loft railing.  Tyler comes forward, SWINGS... SECURITY MONITOR P.O.V. Jack PUNCHES himself square in the nose! INT. MAIN LOBBY Jack's dazed.  Tyler grabs Jack's shirt, pulls him forward, SWINGS HIM -- THROWS him DOWN THE STAIRS... Jack TUMBLES horribly down... HITS BOTTOM, striking his head on the floor.  Jack PASSES OUT... FADE TO BLACK: INT. LARGE SOCIAL ROOM - TOP FLOOR CLOSE ON: Jack's head jerks back as he SNAPS AWAKE.  He looks around, trying to focus his eyes... JACK'S P.O.V. -- TRACKS in the sawdust of the floor, from where his body was dragged across to where he is how. CLOSE ON: Jack tries to comprehend.  He turns his head -- TYLER'S HAND brings the GUN up, PUTS THE GUN IN JACK'S MOUTH.  Jack freezes, looks around with his eyes... PULL BACK TO: Tyler is seated in Jack's lap.  Tyler holds the gun in Jack's mouth, his arm around him.  This huge room is being remodeled.  Tyler and Jack are seated near floor-to-ceiling windows affording a spectacular view of the CITY. Tyler looks at his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think this is about where we came in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the beginning.  We're at ground zero.  Maybe you should say a few words, to mark the occasion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: i... ann....iinn.. ff....nnyin... Jack tongues the barrel to the side of his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still can't think of anything. Tyler checks his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's getting exciting now. Jack turns, so he can see down -- 31 STORIES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look what we've accomplished. (checks watch) Thirty seconds. (looks out windows) Out these windows, we will view the economic collapse.  One step closer to global equilibrium.  I'm glad you're here with me. Tyler watches the skyline, WHISTLES at tune, waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you call it off... ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's out of our hands. (looks at watch) This is it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifteen seconds now.  Can you see alright?  10... 9... 8.... Tyler looks out the windows, at SURROUNDING BUILDINGS, excited.  Jack closes his eyes, despairing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... 4... 3... 2... Out the window, the SKYLINE remains unchanged.  Nothing.  A long beat.  A very dark scowl comes over Tyler's face. Jack opens his eyes.  More waiting.  Tyler looks genuinely surprised, pissed-off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck -- ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paraffin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paraffin.  Your merry band mixed the nitro with paraffin.  I saw it floating in the bomb. (more)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They must've run out of cotton and Epsom salt.  Paraffin is iffy at best. Tyler rises, taking the gun from Jack's mouth, starts pacing.  Jack rubs his sore jowls, allows himself a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn it!  God-damn it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not exactly according to plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do we have to do everything ourselves?! Tyler stops walking, lets out a sigh of disgust.  He reaches into his pocket, taking out a WALKIE TALKIE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Codename Rooster.  Passcode First Strike... Jack's eyes go wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Proceed with remote detonation. Jack leaps -- TACKLES Tyler.  The GUN is knocked away.  Jack STRIKES Tyler's face repeatedly with his elbow, scrambles off... Jack gets the gun, turns, pointing it.  Tyler's getting to his feet, sees the gun, annoyed.  Jack stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haven't we already done this? Jack SHOOTS TWICE.  Bullets pass right thorough Tyler. Tyler just rolls his eyes, drops the walkie-talkie to the floor and STOMPS on it, CRUSHING it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you do that?!  You're a fucking figment of my imagination... you're psychogenic fugue state...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck that, maybe you're my hallucination. Jack falters, pointing at Tyler's feet.  There's no walkie- talkie there.  Jack looks down, sees the WALKIE-TALKIE CRUSHED under his own foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... Christ... Jack holds his head, walks around, at his wit's end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why... why... why... ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why can't I get rid of you?  Why can't I just wish you away?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, I don't. (pause) I thank you, I really do.  Thank you, but I don't need you anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I can be selfish, I know that. (pause) I'm not blind to my own failings...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Noooo, please... Jack backs up against a window, numb and weary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From now on, we'll share Marla. We've been spending too much time apart...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... no, no, no...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No more running off without you. From here on out, we do it together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you doing this?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm doing this for us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please understand... I've gotten all I can from this, Tyler.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I leave, you will be right back where I found you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear on my life, I won't...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will.  You know you will. Jack stares at Tyler, tears welling up, hangs his head.  He looks at the gun in his hand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you live with that? Jack stares at the gun a long time... then... Jack brings the gun up, PUTS THE GUN IN HIS MOUTH. Tyler cocks his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have you left for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you want to do that? Why do you want to put that gun in your mouth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not my mouth.  Our mouth. Tyler is calm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is interesting. Tyler smiles in appreciation, slowly walks forward, stands very close to Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you going with this, Ikea- boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the only way to get rid of you... Jack COCKS the hammer on the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see you feel very strongly.  I feel strongly too. (pause) Hey, you and me. (pause) Friends again? Their eyes are locked, unblinking.  Long silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do something for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Appreciate something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My eyes are open. EXTREME SLOW MOTION: Jack's finger squeezes the trigger... KABLAM! -- Jack's cheeks INFLATE with gas.  His eyes bulge. BLOOD flies out from his head.  The WINDOW behind him SHATTERS.  SMOKE wafts out of his mouth and tear ducts. RESUME NORMAL SPEED as the GLASS FALLS behind Jack... Tyler stands, in gunsmoke, eyes glazed, sniffs the air...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that smell... ? Jack slumps to the floor... Tyler falls... Tyler hits the ground.  The back of TYLER'S HEAD is BLOWN OPEN, revealing blood, skull and brain. Suddenly, a GROUP of SPACE MONKEYS burst into the room, moving forward to Jack.  TYLER'S BODY IS GONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right, sir... ?! Jack quakes, holding the side of his head; a ragged hole blown in his CHEEK.  He's bleeding hard, but he's alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm okay... Jack looks to the Space Monkeys, trying to get his eyes to see.  TWO SPACE MONKEYS enter with Marla.  One holds a gun to Marla as she struggles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure?  You look terrible, sir!  What's happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything's fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, you look really awful!  Do you need medical assistance? Jack sees Marla, tries to get to his feet, falls...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring the girl to me.  The rest of you get out.  Now! The Monkeys bring Marla, releasing her, saluting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened... ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't ask. Marla crouches, takes out wadded TISSUES and tries to apply. them to Jack's wound.  Space Monkeys are leaving, hesitantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get to the rendezvous point.  Move it! Jack and Marla are left alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, you're shot...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Jack tries to got up.  Marla helps him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who did this to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did, I think.  But, I'm okay... I'm fine... MASSIVE EXPLOSION... the glass walls rattle... Jack and Marla look -- OUT THE WINDOWS: a BUILDING EXPLODES; collapsing upon itself.  Then, ANOTHER BUILDING IMPLODES into a massive cloud of dust.  Jack and Marla are silhouetted against the SKYLINE.  Jack looks to Marla, reaches to take her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry... you met me at a very strange time in my life. Marla looks at him.  ANOTHER BUILDING IMPLODES and COLLAPSES inward... and ANOTHER BUILDING... and ANOTHER... The FILM SLOWS, then ADVANCES ONE FRAME at a TIME -- SHOWING SPROCKET HOLES on the SIDES.  EACH FRAME is an IMPLODING BUILDING -- then, ONE FRAME IS A PENIS.  Then, the IMPLODING BUILDING again.  SPEED UP the frames, LOSE the sprocket holes, RESUME NORMAL SPEED...
direction.name: direction
